column12: Adhyaya 1 only, different comm, different edition
verses are part of pañcaskandhaka by Asaṅga, prose Vyākhyā by Sāramati according to Chinese tradition
Siddhasena Divākara more commonly accepted as author
Pandit asserts this is a different Aryadeva
text is both root+comm, BSJ probably wrote latter
Ṣaṭsandarbha is just the name of the edited collection

Authorship confusing: The Chinese tradition attributes the Vyākhyā to Sthiramati, and some sources (based on Tibetan tradition) conflate the Bhāṣya and Vyākhyā, leading to the mistaken attribution of Bhāṣya to Sthiramati.
transmitted as the first krama of Pañcakrama
